page.title: 05Road Repairs On The A40
page.content: The road between Sandhills and Wheatley was repaired in the Autumn of 1984.It cost 1,650,000 pounds. The road was repaired because it was starting to crack with the weather and the car wheels wore it down and made it go bumpy. It took 15 men to repair the road. There were five different layers. The bottom layer was 15 cm of big stones, then there were another 15 cm of smaller stones, then there was 23 cm of even smaller stones, then there were 6 cm of small stones called base course and the last layer is 4 cm of sand and asphalt. So altogether there are 63 cm in a road. When the road was repaired, the kerbs were taken away and a metre of road was added on each side. The hedge was taken from the middle of the road so that big machines could be used. When the road was finished, the hedge was replanted.
